messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Teens?
messages.msgSnippet: Ren said: I think that s an interesting experiment you did Rue! Hi Ren - It was really interesting to see how QUICKLY I could find someone, starting out with
messages.messageBody:
Ren said: I think that's an interesting experiment you did Rue!

Hi Ren - It was really interesting to see how QUICKLY I could find
someone, starting out with just her name and what state she lived in.
Even more interesting to find I only needed to use Google. I've always
loved searching out information (maybe I could be a fact checker?) and
the Internet has changed that so completely. ~Rue


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Teens?
messages.msgSnippet: Kathy said: I found a site online that if you know the persons number it will give you their address and a map to get there! UGGGH scary! Kathy Sullivan Kathy
messages.messageBody:
Kathy said: I found a site online that if you know the persons number it
will give you their address and a map to get there! UGGGH scary!
Kathy Sullivan

Kathy - When I found Kristen's address/phone number links were given to
Mapquest and Yahoo Maps. FYI, all I did was Google to get this info.
~Rue



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Teens?
messages.msgSnippet: Yeah....I forgot about the sepschool thing LOL.  I even did a search for my own name once and found it, etc.  I didn t dive too deep though. I forgot about the
messages.messageBody:
Yeah....I forgot about the sepschool thing LOL. I even did a search for my own name once and found it, etc. I didn't dive too deep though.

I forgot about the IP numbers and ISP's.

Well, guess thats one less "fear" to worry about. I guess I'll tell the kids not to worry about it after all!

Kristen
----- Original Message -----
From: Jon and Rue Kream
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, December 23, 2002 9:20 PM
Subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] Teens?


Kathy said: I found a site online that if you know the persons number it
will give you their address and a map to get there! UGGGH scary!
Kathy Sullivan

Kathy - When I found Kristen's address/phone number links were given to
Mapquest and Yahoo Maps. FYI, all I did was Google to get this info.
~Rue

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Teens?
messages.msgSnippet: I found a site online that if you know the persons number it will give you their address and a map to get there! UGGGH scary! Kathy Sullivan: Mom to Logan 15,
messages.messageBody:
I found a site online that if you know the persons number it will give you their address and a map to get there! UGGGH scary!
Kathy Sullivan:
Mom to Logan 15, Andrew 10, Alexander 6 1/2, and Christopher David 14 months.

DFW-Unschoolers-subscribe@yahoogroups.com

"Some people think that we put our lives on hold to raise a child, but we know that to hold a child IS life"

"To be free to learn, children must be free to dream!"

----- Original Message -----
From: starsuncloud@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, December 22, 2002 11:07 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Teens?


In a message dated 12/22/02 5:24:37 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< I think it's a mistake to assume that if you don't directly give out
your address no one will be able to find it. >>

I did some sleuthing of my own once upon a time, found out the exact location
of a persons house and their birth certificate info. online. There are some
great search engines out there.....and ways to find just about anyone. Which
is great when looking for old friends you've lost touch with!!
I think that's an interesting experiment you did Rue!

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
